overview: With the explosion of available data, statistical learning, which refers to the analysis of complex datasets, has become an important field in many business contexts including marketing, finance, and even human resource management. The aim of this component and the follow-on component in Advanced Business Analytics is to help students learn how to extract relevant information from large amounts of complex data to make improved business decisions. Topics covered in this component include data exploration, resampling methods, linear and nonlinear regression, parametric classification techniques and model selection.
ilo: Determine which techniques to apply to different types of data.
Analyse large datasets and convert raw data into relevant information for management decisions, using parametric and semi-parametric methods.
Develop presentation skills to convey this information to a non-technical audience.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.hurdle: Students are required to pass the final examination to pass the subject
